did.head: Brief Description of the Collection

address.addressline: Special Collections, University of Maryland Libraries, Hornbake Library, College Park, MD, 20742. Tel: 301-405-9212, Fax: 301-314-2634, Email: askhornbake@umd.edu

did.physloc: Radio Advertising Bureau:3rd floor:90:A:3rd floor 90 : E :
did.abstract: The Radio Advertising Bureau (RAB) is a national radio advertising trade organization whose history dates back to 1950. To showcase radio's potential during the rise of the television era, the RAB began collecting examples of ads from all over the country beginning in 1954. Many of these ads were used in workshops and presentations, and by the mid-1960s the RAB had teamed with the Clio Awards in order to recognize the best of radio advertising each year. When the RAB moved from Dallas to New York, they donated the ads to the Broadcast Pioneers Library, which was accessioned by the University of Maryland Libraries in 1994.

descgrp.head: Important Information for Users of the Collection

accessrestrict.head: Use and Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: There are no restricted files in this collection.

altformavail.p: About 850 of these discs (70 hours) have been migrated to DATs.

acqinfo.head: Custodial History and Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Radio Advertising Bureau Collection was part of the Broadcast Pioneers Library (BPL), which was transferred to the University of Maryland Libraries in 1994.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Radio Advertising Bureau Collection, Special Collections, University of Maryland Libraries.

processinfo.p: All discs were removed from their original sleeves and rehoused in acid-free archival record sleeves.

userestrict.head: Duplication and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Digital copies of original materials may be provided for a fee and at the discretion of the curator.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Radio Advertising Bureau (RAB) is a national radio advertising trade organization whose history dates back to 1950. Originally known as the Broadcast Advertisers Bureau, the name was changed in 1955 to emphasize the organization's focus on radio (as opposed to television). The RAB's main function is to promote the medium of radio as an effective tool for national and local advertisers. To showcase radio's potential, the RAB began collecting examples of ads from all over the country. Many of these ads were used in workshops and presentations, and by the mid-1960s, the RAB had teamed with the Clio Awards in order to recognize the best of radio advertising each year. Ads collected for these purposes form what is now the Radio Advertising Bureau Collection in Mass Media and Culture at the University of Maryland Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Radio commercials in the collection are predominantly from the years 1954-1968, with the bulk of the material falling between 1958-1964. The inventory below is meant to give a comprehensive picture of the variety of product advertising represented in the collection.

arrangement.p: Organized as twelve series with some subseries

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For other related archival and manuscript collections, please see the following subject guides.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the University of Maryland Libraries' Catalog. Researchers desiring related materials about these topics, names, or places may search the Catalog using these headings.
